title: $page.route is null on error page
body:
### Describe the bug

Hello.

I have a single `+layout.svelte` which serves as layout for all my pages. In it, I am using the following condition : 

```svelte
{#if $page.route.id !== '/about/enable-javascript'}
    ...
{/if}
```

Although it seemed to be working fine at first, I noticed that `$page.route` is actually `null` when on a 404 page (I am also using a custom `+error.svelte` page). But Typescript does not recognize `$page.route` as being nullable.

Because of an ESLint rule I have set up (`@typescript-eslint/no-unnecessary-condition`), I am forced to use the following at the moment...

```svelte
<!-- eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-unnecessary-condition -->
{#if $page.route?.id !== '/about/enable-javascript'}
    ...
{/if}
```

... Because Typescript reports that `route` cannot be null.

I am not too sure if this is intended, if this is a bug or if I'm missing something.

### Reproduction

Have a `+layout.svelte` page calling `$page.route.id` on a 404 error page. It will throw an error because `route` is `null`, but Typescript says that `route` will never be null.

### Logs
